Reviews.Title: “Very nice place”
Reviews.Author: Vacati0ner1974
Reviews.Content: The botique hotel is very convienently located to many attractions in Old Town Istanbul. The rooms are clean and comfortable, buffet breakfast was impressive. Nice terrace view, staff was friendly and accomodating. Would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “3 days in rainy Istambul”
Reviews.Author: irina m
Reviews.Content: Sumengen Hotel is a really lovely place in a 3 minutes walk to The Blue Mosque! The stuff is friendly and helpfull, rooms are clean and rather nice (and it was warm inside despite the cold and rainy weather outside) and you have your breakfast with panorama of Bosphorus - GREAT! The only problem was poor WiFi in the room. I was in Turkey and Istambul for the 1st time and would surely come here once more and thinking of the same hotel. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Magnificient hotel with great environment and service, located in a great area near blue masjid”
Reviews.Author: UmarBeg
Reviews.Content: It was a great decision to stay at Sumengen Hotel, it was located at a very good location, close to all major attractions of the city, the hotel staff were very helpful and nice, especially Gocken who was helpful in providing answers to all our questions about the hotel services and city, he was very friendly and always helpful where ever possible and ensured we had a plesent stay at the hotel. The breakfast was great with many options, the room was cozy and very comfortable, people complain that it is very close to the railway line and the trains cause a lot of sound which is completely wrong, I would definitely recommend this hotel to all others looking into it. The only minor concern at this hotel was the WiFi, it used to break out occasionally few times, but it was not a big problem as usually it didn't cause irritation despite being a heavy user

Reviews.Title: “Lina”
Reviews.Author: Lina M
Reviews.Content: I am very glad i stayed in sumengen hotel.The location was perfect and the staff's treatment was superb. Ugur, Selcuk, Gokhan,ugur and gozlin were very friendly and very cooperative. They definately made our stay more enjoyable in both the hotel and istanbul. I would definately book in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: ilse v
Reviews.Content: The best if this hotel was the excellent location, the clean rooms and the very friendly and helpfull people. Our room was big, good bed but had thin walls: we consantly hear our neigbours.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Area!”
Reviews.Author: Lyndon4444
Reviews.Content: Not really sure how I stumbled upon finding the Sumengen Hotel when planning my trip to Istanbul, but definitely glad I did. I had made my reservation online and it included a free airport transfer. Upon arrival in Istanbul, our driver was waiting for us and quickly whisked us away to Sumengen. Check in was efficient and the room assigned (404) was perfect for the two of us. Rooms were clean and well maintained. The only issue I had was with the shower - being American I still can't get used to the half glass shower curtain - had same type when in Paris last year. Perhaps I just need to get used to it. The hotel was perfectly situated in Sultanahmet and was a quick 5 minute walk to change currency, the Blue Mosque and other attractions. There's a 'restaurant row' just a block from the hotel which is where we ate every night. A great, great place filled with great restaurants. The breakfast by the hotel was decent. Nothing stellar, but the fresh orange juice was FANTASTIC. Wish there were croissants or other hot food options. Overall a great stay at the hotel, and I've already recommended it to my sister who is planning a trip to Istanbul in June!

Reviews.Title: “I would defo recommend this wee gem”
Reviews.Author: christaBangorCo_down
Reviews.Content: First impressions when we found the hotel were not good it looked like a rund own bed and breakfast from the outside , we had booked the seaview room with jacuzzi and was not disappointed at all , the room was big , wifi conection was strong , breakfast excellent choice , stunning views by the balcony , excellent wee hideaway for a romnantic night in istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Excellent tipical atmosphere and a perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bogomila
Reviews.Content: Thanks for the hospitality wÐµ felt at home. Accidentally came across this offer for the hotel and I am happy that I booked. Pleasant and smiling people from morning till night, cleanliness and tranquility. Wake up with the first rays of the sun, following is a rich breakfast you can share with birds flying against the backdrop of stunning views of the Bosphorus. We recommend the hotel also because of the lively surroundings and the easy access to all important places. And we are a couple that stayed in several Istanbul hotels, but we liked this most. You have to visit Sumengen Hotel to feel better Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Good location with reasonable service”
Reviews.Author: Jumalis
Reviews.Content: The check in/out lady was not helpful. Did not allow for late checkout even though there were rooms available. Created inconvenience for us.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: inomarko
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for romantic getaway because of many great reviews and OK price. Unfortunately we were disappointed - our double room was tiny and maybe because of darkness with worn-out impression, look through window was awful - unkempt backyard full with garbage. Good things - staff was helpful, breakfast was decent, very good view from breakfast room/terrace, very convenient to get to Haga Sophia and Blue Mosque. So overall this hotel might be good as base for exploring Sultanhamet, but not for romance and I strongly recommend to be critical with very exited reviewers, whose only review is just about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful Hotelâ€¦ Highly recommended!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MARIANNA S
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel located in the heart of the Sultanahment. Just three minutes walk from Blue Mosque and Agia Sofia. Galata Bridge, Capali Market, and all of the major tourist sites are within easy walking distance. Many good restaurants and cafes are also located nearby. The Room (we stayed in a triple deluxe) was spacious, very clean with a sea view. Breakfast is rich and is served in a nice room with a fantastic view of the Marmara sea (A perfect way to start your day in Istanbul!!). Staff was really great, very kind and always available to help you. It was my third time in Istanbul but the first time I had such a great accommodation. Iâ€™ll definitely stay again at Sumengen Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: moazzam63
Reviews.Content: 8 nights stay in Sumengen hotel was beautiful experience. very cleanand well decorated rooms, high quality beddings and furtniture. Breakfast lounge was well located, overseeing the marmara sea. Plenty of food selection. Most of all, staff was very courteous. highly highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Murad A
Reviews.Content: Location of the hotel is excellent. It is very close to major Istanbul tourist destinations Blue Mosque, Hagia Sopfia and Topkapi Palace. For people sensitive to noise there is a train line just behind the hotel but the noise is not terrible at all. Besides the trains run every once in a while and not at nights. Rooms are clean and spacios enough (I think the room sizes are comparable to ones in 3* hotels in US). Other neighboring hotels I checked had rooms equal or smaller by size. I have two complains though. First, a refrigerator in my room did not work, and it was not fixed during my stay for 10 days in that room. I need to say I did not insist on fixing though. Second, sound isolation is not up to par. If your neighbour is noisy you might feel involved in their activity. Room and hotel service is pretty good. Personal is very friendly and ready to help. There are several people I wanted to say "thanks" for making my stay a pleasant experience: two pals by the same name Ugur, receptionists Guzin and Okan. Their manager Ibrahim is an intelligent and helpful young man. All in all I would highly recommend to opt for this hotel for its location, qualitiy of service and friendliness of the personal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, friendly staff, local to all main attractions”
Reviews.Author: usman247
Reviews.Content: Our 3 night stay at the Sumengen hotel was excellent the staff were great and very helpful, the rooms and all the facilities one could hope for, the kids loved the Jacuzzi, the buffett breakfast had a nice selection, and the main attractions were within walking distance. Despite having read some of the negative feedback left by previous visitors we did not encounter any one of the negative experiences, definteley would visit again, thank you team Sumengen

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lorraineo1962
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and returned after for another night ! It was a charming hotel in a perfect location the staff great and helpful ! This is the best area to stay as I have been to Istanbul Any times ! You are so close to everything ! Cobble streets and full of character and SO SAFE . Hotel clean and comfortable and breakfast room is awesome ! The most lovely view !

Reviews.Title: “tres bon point de depart”
Reviews.Author: kindjoe
Reviews.Content: situe dans la vieille ville a proximite de tous les sites d'interet, a l'ecart du brouhaha

Reviews.Title: “nice stay, perfect location and position”
Reviews.Author: vallor
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at Sumengen Hotel becouse of the nice pictures and good comments we saw on internet. To be honest, the room is as described on the website. The breakfast-room is wonderful, although at breakfast there is no espresso nor cappuccino available, even paying apart for them. A lot of fruit, burek (we loved it) and biscuits and jams. For us, a good coffee in a foreign country is essential to begin the day. Deluxe rooms with ottoman style furniture are useless, unless a service at the same level. One point: we booked a double room trough Venere, then I wrote directly to the manager to ask for a twin bed room. He repleid I will be given the kind of room I have booked trhrough Internet. Than I call to delete my reservation, becouse I wasn't satisfied of the answer of the manager. I was told by a receptionist that the boss wasn't in the office, but.. After a few seconds I received a new email, confirming a twinbed room. At the check in, no twinbed room, but free upgrade to topfloor room with jacuzzi. The day after, I was told the bathroom was broken, so myroom should be changed to a superior room (standard one). Obviously, no twinbed room available. Again. In conclusion, the hotel is nice and cosy, the people worlking there are friendly, smiling and professional. But: what the hell you are doing with guest preferences? To give the topfloor room with jacuzzi just for the first night sounds like a bad trick, that is to be said. Change room is always disappointing for guests. Avoid that, and ytou willeasily get a higher ranking. Give what you promise, and promise only whay you can give.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and staff”
Reviews.Author: JDN0101
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Istanbul and we stayed for 4 nights at the Sumengen Hotel with friends.We were not sure of the location, but found that it was close to the main attractions in Sultanahmet, all within walking distance. The staff were very helpful and breakfast was more than adequate. We booked two double rooms and was disappointed and had concerns with both. Curtains missing, sheets missing in both rooms and very hot as air conditioning was not working and water from one running into our suitcase. The net curtains could also do with a wash. We had no views.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent vacation in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Sorin_Vasilescu
Reviews.Content: We had a short but excellent vacation to Istanbul also due to Sumengen Hotel accommodation for 4 nights. They gave us one of the nicest room in the hotel with view 100% on Bosphorus and asian side of the town, otoman style furniture and carpets, jacuzzi inside the room, wireless internet available, big and very useful bathroom. They cleaned every day the room and we could feel it immediately we came back from the town. We've been for the first time in Istanbul. Therefore, the receptionists were very helpful in giving us directions for visiting the main touristic atractions of Istanbul. The hotel is located in the heart of the old part of the town being a distance of only few hundreds of meters upto Blue Mosque or Agia Sofia and 1-2 km to Grand Bazaar or Topcapi Palace. Good breakfast every morning available to be served on the terrace of the hotel with Bosphorus view. Around the hotel there are so many restaurants. The hotel has a friendly atmosphere and stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional value through Hotwire”
Reviews.Author: QatarJoe
Reviews.Content: Our family booked this hotel through Hotwire and found it to be excellent value for money. The hotel room rate on Hotwire was about 1/2 the hotel rates of the competitors. The hotel is centrally located in Sultanahmet, so all major sites are within walking distance. Note that the road is on a small incline, but not a problem even for elderly people. Fee breakfast was full selection and always enough for guests. Ask Orkan or any one of the hotel employees about how to enjoy a grilled fish sandwich and beer on Galata bridge for just 10 Turkish Lira!

Reviews.Title: “an ok hotel well located withgreat staff”
Reviews.Author: Yvonneka187
Reviews.Content: not a glowing review just average place good location had to pay extra for a view room very noisy train all night and day underneath hotel. Excellent staff member Mehmet Okan made the stay wonderful. He singlehandedly took care of all our needs, borrowed sweetener from other hotel as they had not bought any when they ran out probably months ago...He brought sheets and covers to personally make up the sofa bed...he is a gem. A big friendly young man who stops at nothing to give the guest a 5 star treatment. He is really special.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: ZWM
Reviews.Content: Great location and very nice clean rooms. Beautiful views.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Bent_dk
Reviews.Content: Very good location close to everythinks. Welcoming and helpful staff, nice and big rooms. I will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Sumengen: highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: bollegijs
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at Sumengen in the jaccuzi suite with Bosphorus view. Thanks to a nice last minute offer, we could get the room for a reasonable price. Room was big, clean, stylish and with indeed a great view and perfect jacuzzi. (in the jacuzzi you have a view on the bosphorus). Breakfast was complete and tasteful. Big up for the fresh orange juice. Coffee was ok, but not great. Some croissants would have made it even better. Personnel is very helpful and masters the English language perfectly. Location of the hotel is without any doubt excellent. (walking distance blue mosk, Aya Sofia, public transport). I'd go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff, comfortable hotel, welcoming atmosphere...”
Reviews.Author: Teddnow
Reviews.Content: .... good location and a hotel to which I would be happy to return!

Reviews.Title: “Worst accommodation in Turkey”
Reviews.Author: RoomReviewz
Reviews.Content: From start to finish, a disaster. Helpful staff but that as the terrible hotel ensured we are asking for help all the time. Rooms - Got a crammed double room, with moulds in the bathroom. Complained about it several times so was shifted to a twin room. The new room was hastily made, with loads of leftovers from previous occupants - personal papers, hair in bathroom. Bathroom sink and shower blocked, and despite repeated complaints, it was not fixed. The mini-fridge was stinking and had bits of fungus growing. Hotel walls are paper thin, (with wallpaper peeling) so our neighbours kept us awake WHOLE night. We called reception three times to complain, took a dizzy walk to the reception at 4AM, and then a new room was give to us to sleep in at 5AM, only to be woken up by cleaners next door in the morning! Thankfully the hotel staff allowed us a late check-out, but not before lecturing that we will know when we have kids!!! Breakfast area - Rooftop dining area the dirtiest I have seen in a long time. Had to go through several spoons to get a clean one. Bread was covered by what looked like a dirty net curtain or an equivalent. The hotel has severe hygiene issues - whether it was the food serving area, or room floors or shower mould, blocked sinks and hair on bathroom floor. No attention is paid to cleanliness. Very noisy as the walls are too thin and you can hear everything going on next door. To be fair some of the hotel staff was good, cooperative and tried to look for solutions like changing rooms, late checkout. But the hotel itself was a terrible let down.

Reviews.Title: “Deceiving pictures of the rooms with Jacuzzi and there is no view!!!”
Reviews.Author: BabyLordess
Reviews.Content: Warning!!!!!!!!!! Deceiving picturesâ€¦furniture is old and stinky and there is no promised view to Bosphorus bridge. You pay extra for the noise of the underneath restaurant (breakfast starts at around 7 and kids screaming and shouting) and constantly running trains from early morning to late at night just outside your window. We paid EUR 165 per night and staid for 3 nights and received only one way transfer from the airport even so if we been promised â€˜â€™transfersâ€™â€™ and not a one way transfer. If I would stay there again I would take a simple double bed because seriously there is no view and the noise of the restaurant and trainâ€¦they should actually compensate for that and not charge extra. However I was very pleased with reception staff (two lovely guys), very helpful unlike the restaurant staff and lady receptionist. Location is great! But there is plenty â€˜â€™fish in the seaâ€™â€™ and much cheaper. Good luck!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel-Great Location-Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: al89-27
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel! The rooms were good and the staff was extremely helpful and friendly. The hotel location is great! You have everything of historic Istanbul in your door step! Breakfast was amazing too-much choice! I would totally come back to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST HOTEL *****”
Reviews.Author: okn118
Reviews.Content: I love thÄ±s hotel so much they are so frÄ±endly especially sati and cihan we love them so much.GÃ¼zn was work on receptÄ±on she so sweet and beautÄ±ful very bÄ±g cat you. hotel was perfect. Ä±f we came back to Ä±stanbul we will stay thÄ±s hotel agaÄ±n. thanks for everythÄ±ng YOU ARE THE BEST TEAM for me...

Reviews.Title: “My wife and I were extremely pleased and satisfied with our stay for one week . we loved it and will back”
Reviews.Author: Laith S
Reviews.Content: Neat hotel in a very strategic touristic location. our room was large and well serviced not less than five star service. for example the quality and number of towels and bath robes is what you find in five star hotels. If the train noise annoys you, the double glazed windows almost anull the noise. we stongly reccomend curtains to be changed to dark to prevent light, because most vacationers like to wake up late. we used eye masks to overcome what is a problem for us and we were fine. We heartly extend our thanks to Mr Ibrahim the General Manager and his hospitable staff.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place with a flexible staff”
Reviews.Author: Soren S
Reviews.Content: Only problem suffered was the lack of door insulation. Any noise in the hallway or conversation carries right into your hotel room. Quite large room though with great bed and good bathroom. Perfectly located in the old town.

Reviews.Title: “we loved it and we will be back”
Reviews.Author: CEYDA Z
Reviews.Content: Istanbul was our last stop over before we returned back to Australia The experience was truly amazing the location of the hotel was a 5 minute walk to the major attractions Haji Sophia Museum, the Blue Mosque, with restaurants and local shops under your feet. The hotel was very clean the staff member's were very helpful Mehmet Cezmi, Cihan and many more they always gave a helping hand when in need with a smile that made you feel welcome like you were at home. I'd definitely recommend and stay back at this hotel as we enjoyed our experience here it was truly amazing.!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great staff”
Reviews.Author: ricardosaba
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife on Sumengen last july for 3 nights. The hotel is very well located, and the staff is great (specially Osman or "Ozzy"), always trying to please us. The rooms areclean and confortable, with a good space. I would stay there again, and i definitely recomend it.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: 56003Lola
Reviews.Content: My recent wonderful visit to Istanbul was enhanced by the proximity of the Sumengen to so many historical jewels. The location is perfect for first time visitors who will visit all the points of interset in the Old City. Also, the hotel is very comfortable and the staff very friendly and accomodating. We started each day with a wonderful, relaxing breakfast and a view of the Marmara. I had such a great time that I am planning a return in December with family and more friends.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad.”
Reviews.Author: AymanN
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in July. Great location as close to Blue Mosque etc and a cool little street with cafes and bars that are open late. Did not hear the train that a few reviewers have mentioned. On the downside, we stayed in room 204, which was disappointing, dated, wallpaper fraying and very dark. In contrast, our friends who stayed on the 1st floor and the 4th seem to have had better rooms. So I guess it depends on which room you stay in. Staff were courteous. However having stayed at both Hotel Nena and Amira, Sumengen has some catching up to do. Breakfast was very average but made up for by the view.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Jalloun
Reviews.Content: Hotel and staff were wonderful. Location in the Sultan Ahmet area was also a plus. Very calming and relaxing. Recommended for persons seeking relaxation.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay immensely>>>”
Reviews.Author: Tez14
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay in the old city at Hotel Sumengen. The service, facilities and location can be highly recommended for anyone considering a stay. We enjoyed our time in Istanbul and Sumengen very much.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, excellent staff.”
Reviews.Author: Buslover80
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent, ten day stay. The room was comfortable and clean and the staff was always incredibly helpful. The location is within easy walking distance to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and an easy tram stop. Okan and Cezmi were wonderful, helping with any and all requests we may have had during our stay. The view from the breakfast area was amazing, although the view from our room was not quite as impressive.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, quite, convenient place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: benbon
Reviews.Content: We were here for a week on a Rick Steves' tour of Istanbul. The hotel was strategically located in the historic core of Istanbul ...very convenient to sightseeing, eating and transportation. Rooms, beds, and baths were totally satisfactory. Breakfast buffet was excellent. Staff was friendly and helpful. Would gladly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Cosy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nettyyaa
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my a few friends.All staff were so polite and helpful.They were ready to help you whenever you need.Especially,Osman and Enes were working well.We were picked up from airport as promised.When we arrived there,a driver was waiting for us.It made us so happy.Breakfast was delicious.We were able to taste different food everyday.I will come back there next summer.I definetely recommend this hotel for guests who want to live zero problem during their accomadation.:):)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mark_111_222_333
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. Clean, decent sized rooms, friendly and helpful staff, great breakfasts and it's in a great location - 2 minutes walk from the Blue Mosque and heaps of restaurants close by. A touch expensive though.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific - If you like staying in a train station!”
Reviews.Author: TexasJetLag
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights at this hotel. At best a 2-star with 5-star prices. My room was on the side of the hotel by the tram tracks. Every 15 minutes, the tram went barrelling by the room rattling the panes in the windows. Also the room must have been above an adjacent hotel kitchen - the smell of grilling meats and fish was overwhelming. Wireless internet never worked. And to top it off, left with many bed bug bites. The hotel did not have change for a 100TL note - on check-out had to wait while the doorman went from hotel-to-hotel in the neighborhood asking for change. I would not stay here again and recommend that you do not.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: mullaneanne
Reviews.Content: We stayed for six nights and were delighted to find that the reviews we had read did not lie, the hotel really is in a fantastic position, just minutes away from all the main tourist sites. I thought this would mean it would be noisy, but it wasn't - though we had a room at the back so maybe the front ones may be noisier, but it didn't strike me as a noisy hotel. The staff, in particular Okan and Ugur were sweeties, very polite and couldn't be more helpful. The room was very clean and roomy, my only complaint would be that it was a little dark as it didn't get the sun during the day because it was at the back of the hotel, but then again, how much time do you spend in the room during the day anyway! There is a train line at the back of the hotel( the Orient Express used to run on it ) but the trains are very infrequent and though I feared the worst when I noticed it, in fact we hardly noticed them. I would definitely recommend the Sumengen to anyone - as a tourist you will not find a hotel in a better position and there are loads of cafes and restaurants close by. By the way - do not miss the Sufi Dancers - definitely worth a visit! I would definitely stay at the Sumengen again.

Reviews.Title: “strategic hotel in the heart of the amazing Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Tortona99
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Sumengen hotel for 4 nights and everything was excellent. The location is really the best you can find to visit the main attractions of Istanbul. Really few minutes on foot from Mosque blu, Topkapi Palace, Santa Sofia, Grand Baazar etc. Conveniently located to take the tram T1 to visit modern Istanbul, Torre Galata and Golden Horn. The room was large and nice and breakfast is served in a terrace with a magnificent view on the sea. A hotel to suggest to spend some days in Istanbul. A lot of goods restaurant nearby.

Reviews.Title: “great location and friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: MissMaggie48
Reviews.Content: Lovely clean hotel in a great location. The staff are really friendly and helpful. Breakfast was an excellent selection and the breakfast room is open all day so you can go in there and enjoy the beautiful view whenever you like. The room we shared was a very nice twin on the top floor. Beds were comfy and lots of extra pillows. The only drawback was that it's a noisy area, which disturbed sleep, but that's not the hotels fault. Would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location and Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: Rpstory
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Istanbul and first time on a group tour. When we arrived at the hotel the staff was immediately available and very friendly. We thought the location was perfect and walkable to everything important. Our room was surprisingly large and very clean. We loved that we could open the windows for fresh air and that it was quiet. The breakfasts were very delicious and nicely presented. There was always someone there to keep things clean and picked up. The only problem was a temporary water shut off the morning we woke up but was resolved within the hour. The other problem was with the internet. It seemed a bit slow and didn't have enough strength to skype.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great staff,all in all a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Charles_Mobbs
Reviews.Content: The Sumengen is located right in the heart of Istanbul tourist centre and all the sights everyone wants to go see. It is also very close to some great restaurants and cafes (we recommend Turquoise - ate there 3 times in 5 nights, also posted a review on here). The hotel staff are very good and we could not fault any part of our stay. We were lucky with (ok, we paid for!) a great room on top floor with fantastic views across the Bosphorus and a jacuzzi bath....... train track outside is also in the way but the double glazing kept that out (as well as the 5am calls to prayer!). Would stay again without a doubt, thanks to all the Sumengen team!

Reviews.Title: “A sense of being taken care of”
Reviews.Author: Rol190479
Reviews.Content: The rooms gave a certain sense of palace luxury and recent renovation, the bath room clean, well designed with beautiful traditionally patterned tiles. Staff met every need and willingly answered every question. Upgrading was no problem. Top-floor breakfast room with terrace where a pleasant light came in from the sky and the Marmera Sea where ships contanstantly passed by. Extra bonus: Five o'clock tea with cakes.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service but let down by hotel itself”
Reviews.Author: Jabsie
Reviews.Content: This is the first time in a hotel where we have had to actually speak to the manager after many days of frustration. We will detail as below points which were discussed with manager on our penultimate day. Positive points: Customer service - staff are friendly and very helpful, much better than most. Location is excellent as you can walk to most attractions such as blue mosque. Negative points: When we arrived, they did not have the room we booked and offered to put 2 beds together. After much commosion, we were given a 1 night upgrade to jacuzzi room until our room was available. Heating - we had to ask for the heater to be turned on every evening as they had an odd system. Sink - after a few requests to front desk staff, manager sorted out the lack of drainage following our meeting. No food allowed in room - we were told about this on penultimate day which was the final straw which triggered our meeting with the manager. The manager explained this rule was in the room directories which were still being printed...we still think no food is an odd room, as no other hotel has had an issue around this. Overall, the decor is great and the staff are friendly. I wouldn't classify this as a 4 star hotel though. Ironically, we miss our room!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint homely hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnontravellerMumbai
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally located in the old city area of Sultanahmet. Stones throw from the Rasta Bazaar and near the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sohia and Underground Cisterns. They have a lovely buffet breakfast spread and a selection of teas and patries in the lobby for evening tea. One of the better hotels we stayed in during our 10 days in Turkey

Reviews.Title: “Warm place to come”
Reviews.Author: Jouni69
Reviews.Content: Hard to think of a better location for first-timers in Istanbul! A few hundred meters from the Blue Mosque and just 100 m from a restaurant street (which we used little) and still a quiet peaceful place. The room was clean and beautiful, even luxurious for my humble tastes. Well, the side plate of the bath tub wanted to spread out but no problem and complaint really. Only the weather could have been nicer (5 days of around zero centigrade, three of those even snowing), but the hotel personnel could not change that and the room was really warm. Apparently winter is not the best time to visit Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “We all loved this Hotel, one of best we ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: amcnamara
Reviews.Content: Everything about our stay at this Hotel was excellent. The staff were great and the service was the best I have experienced. Nothing was too much for the staff. The location could not have been better. We cant wait to go back and would be extremely disapppointed if it was booked out when we wanted to go. We went in January but would love to see it in the summer also.

Reviews.Title: “a very pleasant experience at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: hecticsam
Reviews.Content: Affter an initial mix-up in which we were shown to a room which we had not booked, everything was very good. We were quickly relocated to the correct room which fully lived up to expectations. Noise from neighbouring rooms was acceptable for a hotel (after all it is not a private home) - and street noise etc was less than minimal. the hotel staff were courteous and helpful. The hotel has an excellent location within walking distance of all the main tourist sites and there is a good choice of nearby restaurants. The hotel breakfast (in a room which overlooks the sea) was good.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel to explore the wonders of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Neanwilde
Reviews.Content: This was a trip to get us away from the joys of Christmas in England and it was fantastic. The hotel is lovely - really beautifully decorated and very clean. The staff were extremely helpful and courteous...we enjoyed our evening tea and cake in the lobby. The view from the breakfast area is wonderful...ask to go to the roof terrace and get an even greater view of Hagia Sofia - it's breathtaking. Istanbul is a wonderful city which we have reccommended to so many friends...and the Sumengen Hotel is the best possible spot to stay and take it all in.

Reviews.Title: “We would stay nowhere else in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: elginsharp
Reviews.Content: Everything about the hotel made us feel comfortable during our stay. We would especially comment on the friendliness and efficieny of the staff. Unfortunately we only got to know the names of two, prbably due to non existant Turkish on our parts, Okan and Huseyin but the reception lobby kitchen and bedroom staff were all exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “always with a smile”
Reviews.Author: nizman
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel for three nights, its walking distance to every site in the old city, the staff who we got to know very well - Kadri,okan,ugur,cezmi and others were all excellent and very knowledgeable about local transport and how to get anywhere in the city. the staff were always on hand to help you. breakfast was one of the best variety we have sampled. the staff always greeted you with a smile and made you feel at home. i would recomennd this hotel for couples and families.

Reviews.Title: “I cant wait to come back again”
Reviews.Author: kabsLondon
Reviews.Content: exclent ervice ... freindly and very help full staff.... they speack good english... and would go out of their way to make your stay a good one. i just want to say thank you to all staff Burhan, Husian Uqur the brekfast vrew and the cleaners. for making our stay a really good one.

Reviews.Title: “lovely place with wonderful service and people!! great hotel to stay at!!”
Reviews.Author: JoannAsia
Reviews.Content: My mum and myself stayed at Sumungen in February just trying to spend a few days doing some sightseeing and having some rest far from London ... Hotel is located perfectly. It is near to all the main attractions etc... The view from the terrace (dining area) is absolutly splendid! This hotel would not be so great without truly lovely and wonderful people who work there. Many thanks to all the staff and especially to Mr Mehmet Cezmi for making our short trip to your beautiful city such a memorable exeprience ! Joa :) Definetely we would recommend to everyone .

Reviews.Title: “Dont believe the pictures on the web site and the reservation promise”
Reviews.Author: bruno-catherine
Reviews.Content: After two nights waiting for the Bosphorus view suite in a "superior room" (not really superior and really smaller than on the pictures taken with a big fish-eye), we hopped to spend 5 nights in the "splendid Bosphorus view suite". But we were very desappointed when we saw the room : a small room with the jacuzzi in the bathroom with a small view on the Bosphorus ! Perhaps the room on the website was already occupated by "most important people" than us ? So be careful when you do a website reservation : it could appear a real difference between picture and reality.

Reviews.Title: “A friendly hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: sjr80
Reviews.Content: From booking through to departure we were dealt with in a friendly but efficient manner. Our room was large and comfortable although we felt that the daily cleaning of the room was perhaps a bit rushed! Possibly the best and most varied breakfast we have come across, however, and with great views of the Bosphorous from the dining room. The hotel was even more convenient to the historical sites than we had imagined - just about perfect. Thank you, Sumengen.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Afer74
Reviews.Content: The location really could not be much better, close to all of the main tourist sites and in a very safe area to walk around at night. The rooms are exceptionally large (I stayed in room 303, which I think is classed as a superior double) and the king size beds are very comfortable. The rooms are cleaned to a very high standard every date by a nice lady. The bathrooms are also of a good size and very nicely decorated, they are pretty to look at, with huge mirrors. The water pressure and tempertaure is perfect. The breakfast is absolutely lovely (I have stayed at two other hotels in Istanbul in the last 6 months and only bothered to take the breakfast at each once as it was so drab) - the selection is enormous and, importantly, fresh. There is also a very nice view from the breakfast room. It is true that there is a train line at the back of the hotel but you would have to be a very light sleeper for that to disturb you, two or maybe three trains go past during the night (I only happen to know that because I was unwell one night and did not sleep). The staff are brilliant, professional and courteous and really willing to help. There is also free internet which is handy. I also noticed free cake and tea available in the afternoons/early evenings. Overall, I would recommend the hotel and would stay there again (I got a very good deal the day before with Thomas Cook online so found it tremendous value for money as well). The mini bar was reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “If you are going to Istanbul, stay at Hotel Sumengen”
Reviews.Author: Tonytraveller188590
Reviews.Content: I just got back home from Istanbul and miss it so much already.. Istanbul is a very nice and beautiful city and our stay at Hotel Sumengen made our trip perfect. It's a hotel located at a very central, but quiet and beautiful area. Our room had the right size, was very clean and offered everything that we needed. Sometimes we could hear the sound of the elevator and people talking outside our room, but we got used to it soon. Also you can hear trains passing by (if your window is open), but if you close the window, the isolation is perfect and you won't hear any noise from outside. The staff, definitely PERFECT, very helpful and nice staff with always a big smile. I also had some very nice conversations with Okan, this man is very helpful and knows a lot about Istanbul, he also gives good recommendations on restaurants and things you can do in Istanbul. The other receptionists were also very helpful and nice, but unfortunately I did not get the opportunity to get to know them better. The manager Mr. Guneri gave us a nice room on the sixth floor and the breakfast staff were also very friendly and you can see that everyone works very hard. Thank you hotel Sumengen, I would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone! Greetings from Tony (Amsterdam)

Reviews.Title: “A hidden Gem and friendly, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: CnNnEnT
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent find for us. We initially read other reviews on TripAdvisor and decided to book it. The location is perfect and the hotel staff are extermenly friendly and helpful WE travelled with our two little ones and the staff even helped with them. After a long day of site seeing it is an absolute pleasure to return to the hotel and see the smiley faces of the staff. There is a train line at the back of the hotel. We were initially concerned about this but I am happy to say, it didn't bother as at all. There was no real noise to complain about. The only thing to keep in mind is, the photos of the hotel are very flattering. In reality it is a little runned down. However, it is very clean and the bathrooms are small but new. Also the hotel could provide some extra pillow. The Breakfast is delicious with hot and cold varieties and they make omlettes on demand. Couldn't ask for more. And the chef is very friendly (loves kids ;-P) All in all, it made our stay in Istanbul very relaxed and worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks for Hotel Sumengen”
Reviews.Author: Abritus
Reviews.Content: It was the one of the best hotels in Istanbul. Wonderful turkish bath, rich cuisine, fast room service. Be side of all of them the reason why i select here, it was in center. Also sincerity of receptionist Gokay was great. I really enjoyed the service quality. For my next visiting of Istanbul my choice will be definitely hotel Sumengen.

Reviews.Title: “Turkish Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: disheveledprofessor
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sumengen for 6 nights, December 20-26 2010, and were very pleased. The rooms were spacious; the breakfast was plentiful; the location was excellent [just a few blocks from the Sultan Ahmet mosque]; tea and cake was served in the lobby in the afternoons. The highest accolade goes for the service, especially to Okan and Memo: every question answered, every effort made to ensure that we were satisfied both with the hotel and with our visit to Istanbul. Only one small irritation, in that wifi didn't work in the rooms, and wasn't always a strong signal in the lobby, but it was available in the lobby, as was a computer for guests' use.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff, excellent service and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Inna13
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the heart of Istanbul in a walking distance from the most historical places. Hotel staff is very friendy and always ready to help. Our room was rather big and had all necessary things to feel comfortable. Breakfasts were excellent. I would highly recommend this hotel to my relatives and friends.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience.”
Reviews.Author: NeilPlimmerUK
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about this hotel. Firstly, the location is excellent...a five minute walk to the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofya, the Grand Bizarre, the tram, a number of fantastic restaurants and Turkish baths, and also within very easy reach of the Bosphorous Sea. In fact, the bridge that connects the European side of Istanbul to the Asian side is a twenty minute walk tops (although the tram will get you there in five). I'm very widely travelled, and have stayed at hotels in Asia, Australia, the United States, and all over Europe. I can honestly say that the staff at the Sumengen Hotel are some of the friendliest I have ever met. The level of customer service is what you would expect to receive in a 5* plus hotel. The manager, Okan, couldn't do enough to ensure that my stay was comfortable and pleasant. He's very professional, and his attitude filters down to his staff. The porter, Ugur, is that enthusiastic about customer satisfaction that he really should go into management. The receptionist was lovely. I was literally gobsmacked when I was showed to my room.......the standard is 5*, easily. The bed was super-comfortable, the decorations and furnishing luxurious, and the bathroom even had heated floor tiles. It really was the last word in comfort. Quiet and clean, and guaranteed to provide a sound nights sleep (most important! ). The hotels restaurant provides an incredible buffet-style breakfast....you name it, they've got it. Scrambled eggs, boiled eggs, omlettes, cooked meats, yoghurts, fruit, cereals, fish, pastries and cakes, coffee and a variety of teas, ......the list goes on. You can eat as much as you want, and the food never runs out....the chef always pops in every five minutes to replenish the buffet. To close, don't even consider going to another hotel if you are staying in the Sultanhamet district.......you WILL NOT find a better deal than this......that's a promise.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you very much”
Reviews.Author: ricugoli
Reviews.Content: With my family we stayed in this hotel from December 27 to January 1. Hotel very clean, staff very efficient but also very courteous and kind, always ready with a smile, and willing to provide any assistance. The hotel location is good ... a few steps from the main monuments of the city. thank you very much. Riccardo Ugolini's family

Reviews.Title: “It was one of the best hotel's i ever stayed at Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: ku_jana
Reviews.Content: Location is excellent â€“ in the heart of old city but also very good accessible to all well-known parts of the city. Tram station is just 5 min. away by walking. Room was nice and clean with the excellent view to Marmara sea (upper floors). I liked breakfast â€“ always fresh food and many things to choose. Staff is very friendly and always ready to help with any information about city. I will recommend this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous hotel with fantastic service and hotel staff near the center...”
Reviews.Author: Interrail4ever
Reviews.Content: For my first trip to Istanbul I've chosen this hotel based on the other reviews I've read and at the end the four/five stars better reflect the structure and the hotel staff. The neighborhood of this hotel is safe and quiet, but within a 2 minute walk of the major sites of the Sultan Ahment district. The rooms are very pretty, spacious and clean with modern bathrooms featuring blue Turkish tiles. The service at this hotel is exceptional just from the first second; when we arrived in later night they offer us a cup of tea and a full and detailed description of the city attractions...a sort of two days guide tour around this beatiful city. The breakfast was plentiful and always fresh and the wait staff willing and ready to bring out more of anything or brew a fresh pot of coffee and to top it all off it is served in a beautiful room overlooking the Bosphorus. I highly recommend the Sumengen hotel, and plan to return many more times

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem in istanbul”
Reviews.Author: KhalidQ8
Reviews.Content: We stayed in dec 2010 and the hotel was excellent in all and every aspect, rooms nicely decorated, spacious and comfortable. Hotel staff were super friendly and helpful in every way they can. The breakfast buffet is awesome. U will everything that u could ask for and u will find it fresh and delicious. The only 2 very minor things were house keeping could improve on cleaning a bit more and english speaking channels on tv. However, I would still highly recommend this hotel. Book with confidence: )

Reviews.Title: “Definitely will come back one day.”
Reviews.Author: MostafaWahby
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, very nice staff, Stayed for 5 amazing nights, very good breakfast and good rooms. Only that the wifi connection was not covering the whole room, but everything else was great. And the location was amazing as well. Whenever I visit Turkey again, I will stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great experience”
Reviews.Author: Ektabalraj
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely lovely , with such great staff. They made my 2 year old Son Aryan's trip so enjoyable.He loved it there with all the staff.It has comfortable rooms and absolutely clean place, Good breakfast. Recommended without any doubt. Excellent Hospitality. All the best Sumengen, Its the best,---Chetty"s

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: RafterLady
Reviews.Content: Hotel Sumengen is in a fantastic location near the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia. The staff were very helpful. The room was very nice (our bathroom had heated floors!). Very clean and comfortable. Great Turkish breakfast. Free internet. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Good service, extremely friendly and helpful stuff, very clean, perfect central location”
Reviews.Author: syria2002
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my parents last week in December 2010 and was impressed with it. Stuff was very helpful, professional and friendly. Our room was nice, very quiet and clean. It was cold in Istanbul, but the room had a heater and was always warm. It was easy to use the internet in the hotel. Internet connection was really fast. We enjoyed our daily Breakfast. It was really very delicious. Hotel was very quiet and its location was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “It was the right decision”
Reviews.Author: azacamis
Reviews.Content: We decided on this hotel based on the reviews here and we're glad that we made the right decision. The first thing we noticed when we reach the hotel was how closed it is to attractions like Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia, which are minutes away on foot. The lobby though small was lovely decorated and had a welcoming feel. We were received by Burhan who really made our stay there a memorable experience. He helped us with our queries about Istanbul which was really useful. As the hotel is on a hill and the entrance is on upper side, the lobby is on the 5th floor while our rooms are on the 2nd, as were most of the other rooms. If this is weird to you then you may want to find another hotel. Also, senior citizen may have problems climbing up and down the slope if they intend to explore the area by foot. Our superior rooms was not huge but there's enough space for the two of us without feeling squeezy. My wife love the looks of the room with its furnishing and decorations. Bathroom is pretty normal and comes with a bathtub. The window faces a small garden surrounded by other buildings. One of them was under renovation which kind of spoils the overall nice view. It may not be fantastic but better than facing a vent or something. What matters most is that the rooms are clean and we didn't feel icky throughout our stay. There's a pretty fast wireless Internet access if you bring your mobile devices along or you can use the common PC in the lobby. They also have cake and lovely fruity tea on the house every evening at the lobby which we use to chat with Burhan through the night. The breakfast on the terrace with its view is just lovely and became the motivation for us to not skip it even though we would love to sleep through the morning after a tiring day before. We were glad that they had an English breakfast spread, which was good by the way, as we can be adventurous with Turkish food on our own. I would definitely come back again unless I found another better deal. Great service, nice staff, clean room and location makes it a no brainer. I have one complaint though. The swiveling door on the bathtub makes it a hassle to shower and could be dangerous too to those who are not careful.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Reception!!”
Reviews.Author: Tanti007
Reviews.Content: what an amazing trip i had to istanbul and what a hotel to stay in. the hotel is right in the middle of istanbul making it easy to go to eye sighting to aya sofia, blue mosque and the amazing top kapy . Breakfast is top class and the staff who welcomed and helped me was simply brilliant. especially goky, he made kept us entertained and laughing most of the time while giving us shopping and nightlife advice on where to go. would love to stay in this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “nice stay”
Reviews.Author: amour20
Reviews.Content: the hotel was nice,simple and clean with strategic situation.the staff was very helpful,breakfast is rich and delicious.thank you guzin,cezmi and cihan for our beautiful stay...

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fantastic staff, overall fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: cwile
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. The room was large and very clean. The breakfast had a great variety of fresh food. The staff pleasant and helpful. The location was the best. I would reccommend this hotel to any visitor to Istanbul. Oh, and the price was very resonable too.

Reviews.Title: “5 stars all round”
Reviews.Author: amokhan
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic little hotel situated very closely to all the major tourist attractions. Aya Sofia, The Blue Mosque and Top Kapi palace are all within walking distance. The rooms were very clean and offered great views. Breakfast was fantastic and was served on the fifth floor with splended views. The staff were extremely helpful espececially Guzzi, Burhan and Mehmet, these guys were fab and really took great care of us. Burhan and Mehmet were amazing not only did they arrange everything for us they kept us laughing till the the early hours of the morning. Thank you guys for making our trip so special. We will definetely book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “COMFORT, CONVINIENCE , CLOSE TO ALL MAJOR ATTRACTION AND SERVICE WITH SMILE.”
Reviews.Author: neela01
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights, our stay was very comfortable. Hotel staff are very helpful and they gave us service with smile. e.g. Mehment, Memo,cesmi and breakfast staff cater for all our needs. We are vegetarian but we got good breakfast which keeps us going for whole day long. Hotel staff directed us well to all the locations and restraunts. View of Bosphorous while having breakfast is excellent. I don't know why people complain about seaguls , I was more focousing on the sea view then birds. Believe me Railway is not that noisy , for light seleeper any sound might be a noise. Best part is hotel location which is walking distance from all the major attractions. i recomend this to all who are coming to Istanbul for the first time and those who stayed here will definately visit.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel web page is true in every statement unlike many others.”
Reviews.Author: kerryandnoel
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights and was truly surprised at the room size and helpfulness of the wonderful staff. From the free internet( including computer) and the complimentry tea and cake while using it, to the delicious breakfast with Bosphorus view. Nothing was too much trouble for the desk staff, day or night. The locality close to the major sights was also a bonus, with everything in walking distance. We stayed at 6 hotels across Italy, Greece and Egypt, and this was the best by far in all aspects. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location”
Reviews.Author: CultureIstanbul
Reviews.Content: We spent two weeks at the Sumengen so we got to nkow the staff and area quite well. The location of the Sumengen on a quiet block on the cobblestone side of Sulanahmed, walking distance to the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia, was like being in a quite village 5 minutes away from a large metropolis. Every morning and evening it was a pleasure to start and end our day just walking to the hotel. Our room at the Sumengen (on the 6th floor) was spacious and had a great view of the Sea of Marmara. Every moring you wake up with the view of the fishermen in their small boats doing their work with large cargo or passenger ships moving behind them as they approach or leave Istambul or the Bosphorous. I left the best for the end. The Summingen has a great friendly staff. My wife had a small emergency (she fell on an abrupt stop in the tram) one evening and Okan (the night porter recently turned recepcionist) called the hospital, talked to the taxi driver so he would stay with us and gave us his card to call him from the hospital if he could help. Breakfast are wonderful and extensive at the Sumengen thanks to Mr. Guzin, the friendly chef who taught me a few words in Turkish. Mrs. Guzin, the day receptioninst, was very helpful in finding things out for us and making reservations. If qw needwd a cab, Ugur the porter would get one and make sure the driver had the proper instructions to get us to wherever we were going. I worked late on my emails and every so often, Mehmet, on his own, would bring me tea or coffee to keep me going. At night I would exhange views with the night receptioninst, Mr. Cihan, a fellow engineer.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: luv-travelling-1965
Reviews.Content: The Sumengen Hotel is a great place to stay while vacationing in istanbul. We stayed there for about 5 days in june 2010 and in May 2009. The staff are very polite andhelpful. They showed us a few rooms to accomodate our party which consisted of our family with 2 young children, both our mothers and my sister and her son. The breakfast buffet is on the rooftop and ahas a beautfil view of the bosphorous and the blue mosque. Tee food is good and they made scambled eggs for my daughters whenever we asked. THe laocation is great. They are many good restaurants (try the Turquoise) within walking distance even for young children. The artisan market is up the hill just below the blue mosque and san sofia. Everything is close. We have stayed there 2 years in a row. They even kept one of our extra bags for us while we travelled around turkey and then we stayed there overnight on our way back to the US.

Reviews.Title: “memorable breakfast buffet plus wonderful view”
Reviews.Author: elvinos
Reviews.Content: The Sumengen is the perfect hotel for a couple visitng Istanbul. The rooms are quiet and elegant, but the highlight is most certainly breakfast on the fifth floor terrace overlooking the sea and city. The food is very good too and the staff helpful and friendly

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: SnooPac
Reviews.Content: No problems. Great service from all working there. Specially received lots of help from Gokay. Every question I had, he answered well, and tried to help me all the time. Thanks Gokay and the rest of the staff for helping me enjoy my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: aral61
Reviews.Content: We were in Istanbul on the 28th August for five days. We srayed in Hotel Sumengen which was selected due to the reviews on trip advisoe abd bookings.com. Thanks God!!! The location is terrific for someone who wants to live, feel and smell the air of the very picturesqe old city. Aya Sofia, Blue Mosque and Top Kapi, the highlits of this great City are not more than ten min. walk from the hotel. we had a family room which was great. Much space for all of us, nice bathroom with plenty of amenities, very functionable shower. The room was very clean. Change of towels every day, very proffesional housekeeping service. Very nice breakfast on the upper floor. Great selection of salty or sweet, hot or cold food and beverage. The surrounding area was full of life with plenty of restaurants and bars where very easily you can discover the Turkish cuisine tastes. The hotel staff was excellent. Very friendly, helpful and proffessional. The two transfers (airport - hotel - airport) which were arrangedstraight with the hotel, were very well organised. Congratulations to Ibrahim, the General Manager for his very well organized business. Definitely we'll be back to this hotel on our next visit to this great city with the great people.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: cliffie88
Reviews.Content: My mother and I will forever be grateful for the care and hospitality extended to us by the staff at Sumengen Hotel. The hotel was very clean and had all the facilities that we needed to make our stay in Istanbul memorable. It is the best hotel in the Sultanahmet area and walking distance to all the tourist attractions. The service is first class. We will always come back to Sumengen whenever we visit Turkey.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and very attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: hmrc1954
Reviews.Content: Writing this review whilst at the hotel. Perfect location and the Staff ( thanks Ossi) are pleasant and go out of their way to help.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Comfortable, Central and HEAVENLY”
Reviews.Author: lemonilale
Reviews.Content: True to its location, the decor and the staff fit perfectly into the atmosphere of the surrounding historical landmarks (all of which are 5 mins walk from the hotel). The staff are extremely helpful and friendly - and patient enough to find a taxi and guide us to the nearest soup parlour at 5 in the morning! The rooms are cleaned, sheets changed every morning by 2 very sweet turkish ladies who fit the true profile of the giggly twins that bright up your day. Breakfast is delicious, although you may find it difficult to choose from a range of 35 different choices! For 15 people, all staying at once, all with different expectations, Sumengen had ideal rates, in the ideal location with ideal staff. Istanbul is a magical city, and sumengen is the perfect seat to watch it from. Will Definetly be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and a greater staffâ€¦you will not regret the experience!”
Reviews.Author: HamoDubai
Reviews.Content: Our experience at Sumengen hotel was excellent. If you ever landed there make sure to meet with: Ozzu, Guzin and Ugur. These sweet and professional staff, always smiling and willing to support and offer their services will make you feel at home. Thanks Ozzu for a very warm welcoming at 4:00 am (thatâ€™s when we arrived). Guzin: your continuous support made our stay a memorable one, and the ever-smiling Ugur, you have been a great help. Hope to stay at your hotel again. The Arnaoute Family!

Reviews.Title: “The best location for Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: francesco64_3
Reviews.Content: Very nice small hotel perfectly located in Sultanahmet, 300 mt. from Sultanahmet square and very close to every location to visit within the Saray point. Friendly service, great room with view on the Marmara sea - close the windows at night because the railway is running just under the building but at night trains are less frequent . Go upstairs on the terrace (it's a pity they don't use it) and enjoy the magnificient view of the Blue Mosque, Aya Sophia and the Marmara Sea. It is one of the old Turkey bulding recently restored in Sultanhamet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - comfort,location,staff”
Reviews.Author: Citybreaker90
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 day trip. Booked hotel through easijet. Wonderful hotel, lovely jacuzzi room with views over Bosphorous, helpful staff. breakfast good, plenty of food, even if you choose to eat later. Location is excellent. Just a few minutes walk from Blue , plenty of restaurants nearby. Will definitely retirn and will stay here again. Loved Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: omtatsat
Reviews.Content: It was a great pleasure to stay at this hotel. Nice accomodation, invisible personal, friendly and hospitable atmosphera in the restorant and reception.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Temple7
Reviews.Content: Situated in a very convenient location near the Blue Mosque, the hotel was very comfortable. The restaurant, sadly only served breakfast, but had a wonderful rooftop view. However, there were lots of places to eat nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing ,Cozy, relaxing, Great View and location& Low cost hotel..”
Reviews.Author: Dianushka
Reviews.Content: Has the most relaxing and great view location. center of all monuments (Blue mosque, hagia sophia and topkapi palace) all walking distance not more than 200 meters. nearby you can find great restaurants and bazaars. the hotel is very comfortable, clean and cozy rooms. perfect breakfast with many varieties. very welcoming and friendly staff , you feel as they are your family.

Reviews.Title: “Picturer and reality are not the same....”
Reviews.Author: EmanueleTorino1969
Reviews.Content: I spent there 3 nights. This hotel is quite strange. Lobby is at 4th floor, that is at street level in the front of the hotel but all the room are in the rear side, so you go downstairs. The position of the hotel is really good, as quite all the hotel in Sultanhammet, but I got a room of 1st floor, it means road level, really noisy, and quite disorderly, but clean. The real disaster was the breakfast room and its terrace. Dusty and not cleaned by the waiters, with a lot of insects and a magnific view on the railway. Two are the point I can't accept: first the price really too expansive and second the fact that the picture and the description of the hotel are really different form the reality. Positive point is that the service people is really nice.

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly friendly and a wonderful place to sleep”
Reviews.Author: anja-seb
Reviews.Content: Had a room with Jacuzzi and view other the sea and all the big ships; great location and great rooms. We found the quality of the bed simply amazing, fantastic sleep quality! The staff were mega-mega-friendly and so helpful! It was really a pleasure to stay there; would recommend it anytime. A wonderful place!

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel i felt at home and the people that work there are the nicest!”
Reviews.Author: marthagabriela
Reviews.Content: I liked a lot the hotel because its really cozy, I went with my family and i felt so comfortable as if i was home. The service is really good but mostly the people that work there are super nice, everyone i met there was extremely warm and helpful, especially Ozzy! Loved Istanbul, the food and the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: CamilaCoimbra
Reviews.Content: I loved my staying at Sumengen Hotel. The employees were very receptive, the localization is the best, the room was very clean and confortable, and it also has a good price. I had a great time there!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hemingo
Reviews.Content: We were very satisfied with the hotel; The service, the clenliness, the location, free internet, good brekfast. Short way to go if you woul see the famous mosqes and other interesting objects. Nice view over the sea from the breakfast balcony. Maybe a little too expensive in relation to the service? We recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay when visiting Istanbul's old city”
Reviews.Author: jcdup55
Reviews.Content: Well situated, very friendly & helpful staff. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous hotel with friendly service in a fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: katie_louise27Ankara
Reviews.Content: I am an American living in Ankara, Turkey and have stayed at the Sumengen hotel three times now: once with my parents on their first visit to the city, once with my sister, and once with my husband. All three stays were perfect. The neighborhood of this hotel is safe and quiet, off the beaten path, but within a 2 minute walk of the major sites of the Sultan Ahment district. This neighborhood is packed full of hotels, and after spending an afternoon with my husband exploring the neighborhood and many of it's hotels while trying to decide where to stay, we chose Sumengen because its friendly staff, newly renovated rooms and welcoming atmosphere stood out well above the rest. The rooms are very pretty, spacious and clean with modern bathrooms featuring blue Turkish tiles. I have stayed in rooms on the front and back of the hotel and never been bothered by street noise or neighboring rooms. The service at this hotel is exceptional, the manager, Ibrahim, went well out of his way to make sure we were comfortable and had everything we needed during each stay. The staff at the front desk were always helpful too, even speaking to taxi drivers over the phone when I needed help getting back to the hotel at night and giving directions or looking up ferry boat schedules when we needed help. Turkish hotels typically supply a breakfast spread, but they are not always very good. At Sumengen the breakfast was plentiful and always fresh, and the wait staff willing and ready to bring out more of anything or brew a fresh pot of coffee (even beyond 10:30am when breakfast ends), and to top it all off it is served in a beautiful room overlooking the Bosphorus. I highly recommend the Sumengen hotel, and plan to return many more times!

Reviews.Title: “Go and stay there !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Fleur_34
Reviews.Content: I've been in Istanbul for many times, but It was my first time to be there for holiday.I found this hotel through internet. It is a nice thing that hotel gives free pick up service from airport to hotel for reservations which have been done over three nights.I stayed there 4 nights. The hotel is in the heart of old city and so close to historical monuments such as topkapi palace,santa sophia,grand bazaar... You have your breakfast on the terrace that looks over the Marmara sea.. Hotel staff are so kind hearted and always ready to help you in case of having problems.Thanks to osman for offering us nice turkish tea after tiring Istanbul days. 4 nights are not enough to explore all Istanbul.I will definetely come back there and prefer to stay Sumengen Hotel. You will not be regret to stay there..

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in brilliant location.”
Reviews.Author: Linda186233
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sumengen hotel in Sultanahmet and it was really lovely and so close to Blue Mosque, Haghia Sofia, Topkapi etc. Great breakfasts with lovely views from the terrace. Trams packed but brilliant to get around on and it has been extended since my last visit - we were able to get within a short distance of the Dolmabahce Palace. Istanbul is a fantastic place but extremely busy with much queuing.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: glossatore
Reviews.Content: Despite the very little common spaces ( to be renewed ), this is a good hotel. Bedroom with an enjoyable sofa zone, " hard " beds ( in which you sleep firmly without " sinking " ),bathroom with enough courtesy set. Everything clean like the city, you never have " dirty " impressions. Wonderful the roof garden overviewing the bay ( Marmara Sea ) in which a rich breakfast is served. Only one thing missing: an expresso coffee machine, whose introduction - and aptitude to use it! - would be very pleasable. The cock-crow and the muezzin's sing don't disturb too much. Just a walk far from Blue Mosque, Topkapi, Aghia Sophia, Horses' Square and tramway stop. Helpful reception desk. Very good relation between quality and prices.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant but cozy hotel in the Sultanahmet old town area”
Reviews.Author: Sotor
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in a traditional "konak" style house, just below the Arasta bazaar in the Sultanahmet old town area and offers comfortable tastefully furnished spacious rooms. There is no restaurant any longer, but the breakfast room and balcony has a splendid view of the Marmara sea. The breakfast buffet is comprehensive and features also very tasty home-made bread, pastry and cookies by chief cook Cihan.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy small hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: MJKE
Reviews.Content: Sumengen hotel is a good quality small hotel close to historic sights. Breakfast is good. A small train runs nearby but not at night. Personnel is very helpful and service minded. Excellent place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with a splendid view on the Marmara sea during breakfast”
Reviews.Author: biohax
Reviews.Content: Well located hotel, near the blue mosque. We had the family room and it is quite spacious. The personnel was very helpfull, we were there during the problems with the volcanic ash from Iceland, and were offered a flexible prolongation of our stay, until our return to Belgium.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location to walk to tourist sites in old city”
Reviews.Author: Maven-at-large
Reviews.Content: Located in an area populated by restaurants. Convenient to walk to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, Grand Bazaar, etc. -- but bring walking shoes because the entire Sultanahmet area is up and down hills. Hotel is small and clean. Rooms are 'decorated' in Turkish style, not western style. Rooms are comfortable and clean, but none too large. Not all rooms have showers, so to get one that did we took a room that was in the back of the hotel. My wife, to whom bathrooms are important was pleased with it. The fact that our room was in the back of the hotel was in itself was no problem, but there's a tram that runs from something like 6:00 am - 1:00 am, so if you're a light sleeper (and/or if you're not used to city noises) you may be bothered by the noise of the tram. This will be particularly true if you have the windows open. Service was good, but not all hotel staff is as fluent in English as we'd have liked. The Sumengen has a buffet breakfast -- pretty extensive, but mostly unchanging from day to day. Nevertheless, you can certainly eat as large a breakfast as you'd like. Oher than breakfast, there's no restaurant in the hotel itself, but there are plenty in the neighborhood, and there's one at the Obelisk next door -- also a Great Western. There's no spa or massage in the Sumengen either, but -- as with the restaurant -- there is next door. There you can arrange for a Turkish-style massage. There's a computer with Internet access in the lobby that's available for guests' use (at no charge), so you can check your email, etc. Nice. If you're looking for the height of luxury, the Sumengen should not be your choice. If you want to wander through the old city from a comfortable, clean, convenient hotel with a reasonable room rate, this is a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you”
Reviews.Author: karlacker
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel, perfect location, friendly staff and a great view from the breakfast terrace

Reviews.Title: “A very helpful and welcoming staff in a beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Poppet_10
Reviews.Content: After our trip from Gallipoli, a very emotional and beautiful place as well we set off to Istanbul .My husband and I have never been there but our friends who organised the trip, have and suggested we go there. We have had a wonderful trip there and recommend Istanbul and this hotel.We found them to be most helpful and very obliging even when the information we required for various things. They helped us when the recent volcanic problems happened.

Reviews.Title: “You certainly should stay there!”
Reviews.Author: TravelleeMoscow
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, clean large rooms, very friendly stuff, delicious breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “a magnificent experience”
Reviews.Author: Danielita1978
Reviews.Content: The hotel was really nice in a great position in front of the seeside and the Blu mosque. the breakfast was really good and the room were clean the staff was very kind and helpfull I recommend this hotel coz I had a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “splendid”
Reviews.Author: NorwayJan
Reviews.Content: We had a fabolous stay at this hotel. The location was great, the seaview from our room was great and so was the jacuzzi after long days out walking. The breakfast was ok, and the neighbourhood was nice. We would like to return some day. There was a bit noise from the train passing by, but not very disturbing for us.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location-service”
Reviews.Author: rospivosbra
Reviews.Content: the location is excellent as also and the all guys that work in the hotel. Î¤ÎŸ Î£Î¥Î£Î¤Î—Î�Î© ÎœÎ• ÎšÎ›Î•Î™Î£Î¤Î‘ Î¤Î‘ ÎœÎ‘Î¤Î™Î‘

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable experience overall, certain gripes though”
Reviews.Author: daydr3am3r
Reviews.Content: Beginning with the positives: If you want to be near the historical center of Istanbul, the Hotel couldn't be located at a more convenient place. Topkapi, Aya Sofya, The Blue Mosque, et. al. are all within walking distance. Breakfast is satisfactory with good variety, and the restaurant has a lovely view to the Sea of Marmara. Room cleanliness is excellent in my limited hotel experience, we changed two rooms during our stay and both rooms were squeaky clean. Hotel staff was quite friendly albeit be warned, English language fluency isn't commonplace. On to the negatives: Although we booked the room 3 months in advance and asked for 2 single beds, we weren't provided with such during our first night there. This was more about the hotel being probably at full capacity than negligence, but still, prior notification would be thoughtful. If you are a heavy Internet user, like myself, be warned that Wireless Internet wasn't of any use. At least in the floors we were staying (1st and 4th), we just weren't able to either have a signal of the Hotel SSID (1st floor), or the Access Point was malfunctioning and the Internet connection was constantly being reset (4th). This may or may not be temporary and/or specific to the floors we were staying. That being said, there's a PC at the lobby that may be used which has wired Internet access and works fine. Finally, Floor numbering isn't what one quite expects. Since the Hotel is built uphill, the 4th floor is actually the ground floor by way of the entrance. So if you're staying at the 1st floor, you're actually going to take the elevator 3 stories DOWN :) Overall, I would recommend this hotel but it would be heavily depended on the needs of the traveller :)

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in my holidays”
Reviews.Author: Vitaliyyy
Reviews.Content: The Hotel - is very good and staff - very helpful! We are return in this Hotel in our next visit in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great place”
Reviews.Author: JimboLux
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, not too big, but with good size rooms. Very nice rooms, except for a bit of a hard bed! Breakfast was fun - a traditional turkish breakfast with a very nice outlook from the breakfast room. Very nice welcome at reception. I'd recommend the hotel's airport transfer too, very easy and convenient. The only minor point was my room was on the 5th floor, the same floor as the breakfast room, and I was woken at 6am to the banging and clattering of breakfast being prepared. So, would recommend this hotel, but try to avoid the 5th floor!

Reviews.Title: “Sumengen hotel - is just what you are looking for”
Reviews.Author: Sola-solena
Reviews.Content: We liked this hotel very much. First of all - great location. The hotel is situated near almost all central sights. We also were surprised the politness of the crew. All the personal was very friendly. And breakfasts were good.

Reviews.Title: “exactly what we were looking for....”
Reviews.Author: chanalis
Reviews.Content: To sum up and make it easy... Location: next to all the main sites, surrounded by restaurants, but is still nice and quiet to get some good rest. Price: get what you pay for and a bit more. this is always a tough one, so dont expect to stay at a four seasons for the rate that you pay, but you do get very good value for money.
